page.title: 17LISSANOURE CASTLE
page.content: In this area there are the ruins of {Lissanoure Castle.}This building was started in 1770 by{Lord Macartney}who was British Ambassador to China. It was completed in 1829 by{George Hume {Macartney.}It was a strange structure in that it had windows only in the front. The other three sides had battlements. Some barrels of{gunpowder}had been stored in the Castle from 1790, and it is thought some of it had spilled. At noon on{October 5th, 1847}the powder exploded(it is believed sparks or a flame touched it), and the Castle was demolished.{Mrs George Hume Macartney died in the blast. Long before, on the same site there stood the{old Castle}which was built by{Sir Philip Savage}in the year{1200.
